data: ANES Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) - Day Surgery
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Restricted to Department of Anesthesiology
PACU nurse to discontinue ANES Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) and initiate the Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) plan
Nurse to Discontinue Order Set/Phase
Discontinue ANES Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Patient Care
Notify Treating Provider
Notify anesthesiologist prior to patient transfer out of PACU
Communication Order
Do NOT give any opioids, CNS depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by Acute Pain Services (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology
Communication Order
Do NOT give any opioids, CNS depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by Family Practice Maternity Service Group 2 or Perinatal Addictions Service
POC Glucose Whole Blood
once
Continuous Infusions
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
plasmalyte continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.45% (D5-1/2NS) continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
lactated ringers continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Medications
Pre-operative medications for chronic pain should be re-ordered and / or equivalent opioid conversion ordered
IV Opioids
fentanyl PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mcg, IV, q5min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 12.5 to 25 mcg, IV, q5min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
morphine PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, IV, q10min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 2 to 3 mg, IV, q10min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 0.2 to 0.4 mg, IV, q5min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 0.1 to 0.2 mg, IV, q5min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
PO Opioids
morphine PRN range dose
dose range: 5 to 10 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 2 to 4 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
oxyCODONE should NOT be ordered for obstetric patients
oxyCODONE PRN range dose
dose range: 5 to 10 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, PO, q3h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
acetaminophen
975 mg, PO, q6h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
650 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
acetaminophen
650 mg, rectal, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: supp
975 mg, rectal, q6h, PRN pain, drug form: supp
NSAIDs contraindicated in renal dysfunction. Verify if NSAIDs ordered by surgical service
Select only one NSAID
naproxen
500 mg, PO, once, PRN pain, drug form: tab
ibuprofen
400 mg, PO, once, PRN pain, drug form: tab
diclofenac EC
50 mg, PO, once, PRN pain, drug form: tab-EC
diclofenac
50 mg, rectal, once, PRN pain, drug form: supp
100 mg, rectal, once, PRN pain, drug form: supp
ketorolac
15 mg, IV, once, PRN pain, drug form: inj
30 mg, IV, once, PRN pain, drug form: inj
Surgeon will order ondansetron for ERAS patients
ondansetron
4 mg, IV, q8h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 12.5 to 25 mg, IV, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
metoclopramide PRN range dose
dose range: 5 to 10 mg, IV, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
dose range: 10 to 20 mg, IV, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
haloperidol PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, IV, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
dexamethasone
4 mg, IV, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
diphenhydrAMINE
25 mg, PO, q6h, PRN itching, drug form: cap
diphenhydrAMINE
25 mg, IV, q6h, PRN itching, drug form: inj
12.5 mg, IV, q6h, PRN itching, drug form: inj
naloxone
0.04 mg, IV, q15min, PRN itching, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj
meperidine
12.5 mg, IV, q15min, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
25 mg, IV, q15min, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
salbutamol
2.5 mg, nebulized, q1h, PRN shortness of breath or wheezing, drug form: neb
5 mg, nebulized, q1h, PRN shortness of breath or wheezing, drug form: neb
salbutamol 100 mcg/puff inhaler
2 puff, inhalation, q1h, PRN shortness of breath or wheezing, drug form: inhaler
If ordered the following modules will only be active in the PACU and will be discontinued when patient leaves PACU
ANES Respiratory Depression (Module)
ANES Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) (Module)
ANES Insulin Subcutaneous Sliding Scale Post Operative (Module)
Laboratory
CBC Without Differential
Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit Collect: Yes, Collection: T;N, once
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit Collect: Yes, Collection: T;N, once
Respiratory
Oxygen Therapy
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 93% or greater
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 90% or greater
